de.deadmist.deadSimpleHttp.structures

Class Response

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.deadmist.deadSimpleHttp.structures.Response

  • public class Response
extends Object
    Represents a HTTP response that can be send to a client
    Every response has the date and server headers set automatically.
    Author:
    Deadmist

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Response()
      Creates an empty response without status code or version
      Sets date header and server header (default "deadSimpleHTTP")
      Response(byte[] binaryBody)
      Creates a response with status code 200 OK and includes the body
      Response(String body)
      Creates a response with status code 200 OK and includes the body
      Response(String status, String body)
      Creates a response
      Response(String status, String body, float httpVersion)
      Creates a response

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getBytes()
      Gets this response as a byte array
      Use this for sending data to a client, otherwise binary data (images etc.) will get corrupted
      void setBody(byte[] body)
      Sets the body as a byte array
      void setHeader(String header, String value)
      Sets a headers value
      void setHttpVersion(float httpVersion)
      Sets the HTTP version (1.0 or 1.1)
      static void setServerName(String serverName)
      Sets the server name that gets send with every response default is "deadSimpleHTTP"
      void setStatus(String status)
      Set status code and message (e.g. "404 Not Found")
      String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the HTTP response including header and body
      DO NOT USE THIS TO SEND DATA
      The conversion to a string will break any binary data that may be included in the body.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Response

        public Response()
        Creates an empty response without status code or version
        Sets date header and server header (default "deadSimpleHTTP")

      • Response

        public Response(byte[] binaryBody)
        Creates a response with status code 200 OK and includes the body
        Parameters:
        binaryBody - Binary data to include as the response body

      • Response

        public Response(String body)
        Creates a response with status code 200 OK and includes the body
        Parameters:
        body - String that represents the body

      • Response

        public Response(String status,
                String body)
        Creates a response
        Parameters:
        status - Status code and message, e.g. "200 OK"
        body - String body to include

      • Response

        public Response(String status,
                String body,
                float httpVersion)
        Creates a response
        Parameters:
        status - Status code and message, e.g. "200 OK"
        body - String body to include
        httpVersion - sets the http version (1.0 or 1.1)

    • Method Detail

      • setServerName

        public static void setServerName(String serverName)
        Sets the server name that gets send with every response default is "deadSimpleHTTP"
        Parameters:
        serverName - the servers name

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        Gets this response as a byte array
        Use this for sending data to a client, otherwise binary data (images etc.) will get corrupted
        Returns:
        Byte representation of the response

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the HTTP response including header and body

        DO NOT USE THIS TO SEND DATA
        The conversion to a string will break any binary data that may be included in the body. Only use this method for debugging. See getBytes() for sending data to a client.

        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        String representation of this response

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(String status)
        Set status code and message (e.g. "404 Not Found")
        Parameters:
        status - status code and message

      • setHttpVersion

        public void setHttpVersion(float httpVersion)
        Sets the HTTP version (1.0 or 1.1)
        Parameters:
        httpVersion - the HTTP version

      • setBody

        public void setBody(byte[] body)
        Sets the body as a byte array
        Parameters:
        body - the body

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(String header,
                      String value)
        Sets a headers value
        Parameters:
        header - Header to set (e.g. "Content-Length")
        value - Value of the header field
